title: Key​
content: </> type Key = {} InputType: Enum.KeyCode | Enum.UserInputType, --// The Key Code Normal: number, --// 1 for Positive, -1 for Negative __type: string, Axis: Enum.Axis | nil --// }

title: Action​
content: </> type Action = {} Name: string, Keys: {Key}, Invert: boolean, Type: number, --// 1 for Boolean, 2 for Number, 3 for Vector2 __type: string, Axis: {Enum.Axis} | Enum.Axis | nil }

title: NewKey​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> info.NewKey( InputType: Enum.KeyCode | Enum.UserInputType,-- The input type Normal: number,-- The number your keycode will be multiplied by, 1 or -1 Axis: Enum.Axis | nil-- Where your keycode axis will go on ) → Key Create a Key.

title: NewAction​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> info.NewAction( Name: string,-- The name of the input Action Keys: {Key},-- All of the buttons that will trigger the event Invert: boolean,-- Inverts the value Type: number,-- The returning value: 1 for Boolean, 2 for Number, 3 for Vector2 Axis: {Enum.Axis} | Enum.Axis | nil ) → Action Create a input Action.

title: TableToKeys​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> convert.TableToKeys( Table: {Enum.KeyCode},-- The table of your keycodes Normal: number,-- The number your keycodes will be multiplied by, 1 or -1 Axis: Enum.Axis | nil ) → {Key} Convert a table of keycodes to a table of Keyinfos. ex: {Enum.KeyCode.W,Enum.KeyCode.Up} -> {{KeyCode=Enum.KeyCode.w,Normal=1},{KeyCode=Enum.KeyCode.Up,Normal=1}}.

title: TablesToKeys​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> convert.TablesToKeys( PositiveTable: {Enum.KeyCode},-- The table of your keycodes that will be positive NegativeTable: {Enum.KeyCode}-- The table of your keycodes that will be negative ) → {Key} Convert multiple table of keycodes to a table of Keyinfos. Put your table of keycodes you want positive in "PositiveTable" parameter and your keycodes table that you want negative in NegativeTable parameter.

title: assert
content: On this page assert This item only works when running on the client. ClientThis item is only intended to be used by the module's authors. Private Show Private Where all of the checking is handled.

title: Triggers​
content: </> type Triggers = {} Began: signal.signal, Ended: signal.signal, Changed: signal.signal, }

title: Manager​
content: </> type Manager = {} Triggers: Triggers, Value: boolean | number | Vector2 | Vector3 }

title: Manager​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> manager.Manager( Manager: Action-- Your action holding your data ) → Manager Where you action will be handled, this is the main function.

title: Connect​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> signal:Connect( CallbackEvent: function-- The event that will be called when the signal is fired ) → () Connect to the signal to get callbacks.

title: Enable​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> signal:Enable() → () Enable the signal

title: Disable​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> signal:Disable() → () Disable the signal.

title: NewTrigger​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> triggers.NewTrigger() → signal This is a trigger, where keycodes will send a signal if they are pressed or changed, note that signals are automatically disabled so you will have to enable them to use the connection.

title: invert
content: On this page invert This item only works when running on the client. ClientThis item is only intended to be used by the module's authors. Private Show Private Where all of the inverting is handled
